response_parsed.title: Refactoring CLI Tools Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to modernize command-line interfaces (CLI) using FastAPI, a powerful web framework in Python 3.12+, offering improved performance and ease of development.
key_points: Leverage FastAPI's flexibility for building APIs that also serve as CLI tools
FastAPI provides automatic code generation for API documentation, making it easier to create interactive CLI interfaces
Integrate FastAPI with argparse for handling command-line arguments and options
Utilize type hints, enums, and other Python 3.12+ features to write cleaner, more maintainable code
Leverage async/await syntax for improved performance when dealing with I/O operations

code_examples.code:
import argparse
args = argparse.ArgumentParser()
args.add_argument('--my-arg', type=int)

version_notes: FastAPI version 0.70.0 or higher is required for CLI support
Python 3.12+ is recommended to take advantage of new features such as async/await syntax
caveats: FastAPI's CLI functionality is still relatively new, and some edge cases or advanced use-cases might not be fully covered
FastAPI's CLI support may not offer the same feature set as dedicated CLI libraries like Click or Argparse itself
